poem:
### Operation Midway

In this city of wind,  
they swept through the quiet streets,  
catching shadows without shadows,  
detaining those whose only crime  
was a love that crossed borders.  
The numbers speak softly,  
whispering into the morning air—  
all these lives, uprooted,  
caught in the net of rhetoric,  
far from the "worst of."
